awd_titl_txt: Extending Math and the Mind's Eye Materials
awd_abstract_narration: This project will extend the materials developed under the Math and the         Mind's Eye project (MDR 840371).  By drawing upon  capacity for visual          thinking using manipulatives, models, sketches, and diagrams, students          develop an understanding of mathematical concepts and create meaningful         mental images that help them retain and recall this information.                Presently the materials consist of (1) 335 pages of classroom activities        organized into six units, and (2) The Visual Mathematics Course Guide,          volumes I and II, containing 160 sequential lesson guides based upon the        classroom activities.  The project will develop volumes III and IV of           the series to cover formulas, functions, graphs and equations, ratio and        similarity, introductory probability, descriptive statistics, and               geometric transformations.                                                                                                                                      When complete, the four volumes will comprise a two to three year               integrated middle school curriculum in mathematics which can be used            also with high school students with limited mathematical backgrounds.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
